byline.contributor: Eric Eagan contributed reporting from Hattiesburg, Miss.

abstract: Constitutional amendment facing voters in Mississippi would declare a fertilized human egg to be a legal person, effectively branding abortion and some forms of birth control as murder.
snippet: A constitutional amendment facing voters in Mississippi would declare a fertilized human egg to be a legal person, effectively branding abortion and some forms of birth control as murder.
lead_paragraph: A constitutional amendment facing voters in Mississippi would declare a fertilized human egg to be a legal person, effectively branding abortion and some forms of birth control as murder.

headline.main: Push for ‘Personhood’ Amendment Represents New Tack in Abortion Fight
headline.print_headline: Voters in Mississippi to Weigh Amendment on Conception as the Start of Life
headline.seo: Push for ‘Personhood’ Amendments Is New Tack in Abortion Fight
